generif.text: Positively regulates Serum Amyloid A3 (SAA3). Identified as SAA3 Enhancer Factor (SEF).
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Activates Exon 1 Enhancer of Pax6 along with Sp1

The human PcG protein dinG interacts with CP2, a mammalian member of the grainyhead-like family of transcription factors, in vitro and in vivo. The functional consequence of this interaction is repression of CP2-dependent transcription
Mutation of a transcription factor, TFCP2L3, causes progressive autosomal dominant hearing loss, DFNA28
Case control study indicates LSF polymorphism may have a moderate protective effect against the risk of Alzheimer's disease.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

CP2 is a major factor in the regulation of globin expression in human and mouse erythroid cells, and CP2 binding to the globin gene promoter is essential for the enhanced transcription of globin genes in erythroid differentiation.
LBP-1c/CP2/LSF may have a role in Alzheimer's disease
Observational study and meta-analysis of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
The functional interaction of CP2 with GATA1 in the regulation of erythroid promoters was studied.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
CP2/LBP-1c/LSF as a factor that likely mediates enhanced transcription of GARS-AIRS-GART in Down syndrome-related Alzheimer disease.
Observational study of gene-disease association and gene-gene interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
a novel mechanism by which RNF2 and PHB2 modulate the CP2-mediated transcriptional pathway.
The protein structure prediction of CP2 family in order to elucidate the molecular mechanism of the CP2-directed regulation of gene expression.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
SRY is a hybrid of DGCR8 and SOX3, and is regulated by the transcription factor CP2.
The expression of osteopontin (OPN), a gene regulating every step in tumor progression and metastasis, was robustly up-regulated by LSF.
Study show that CRTR-1 is generally an activator of transcription and that it modulates the activity of other family members, CP2, NF2d9 and altNF2d9, in a cell specific manner.

Secreted OPN, induced by LSF, activates c-Met via a potential interaction between OPN and its cell surface receptor CD44. A significant correlation was observed among LSF, OPN, and activated c-Met levels in HCC.
Data suggest that LSF is a key mediator of the Notch1 signaling pathway, suggesting that it might be a novel therapeutic target for the treatment of hepatocellular carcinoma.
Inhibition of MMP-9 significantly abrogated LSF-induced angiogenesis as well as in vivo tumorigenesis, thus reinforcing the role of MMP-9 in facilitating LSF function.
Antiproliferative small-molecule inhibitors of transcription factor LSF reveal oncogene addiction to LSF in hepatocellular carcinoma
LSF is an important mediator in colorectal carcinoma tumorigenesis and progression, and LSF expression is an important index for and prognostic prediction.
The results suggest potential roles of LSF (TFCP2 ) as a growth regulator through control of the transcription of p21CIP1 in melanocytes and melanoma cells as well as a biomarker for nevus.
Complement proteins C7 and CFH control the stemness of liver cancer cells via LSF-1 pathway.
FQI1 mediates alteration of the tumor epigenome by DNMT1-LSF complex disruption, leading to aberrant DNA methylation and gene expression.
High expression of CP2c was significantly correlated with patient age, and higher histological grade, stage, and small and large vessel invasion in HCC tissues.

Metformin disrupts malignant behavior of oral squamous cell carcinoma via a novel signaling involving Late SV40 factor/Aurora-A. Findings showed that a novel Late SV40 Factor and Aurora-A-signaling inhibition supports the rationale of using metformin as potential oral squamous cell carcinoma therapeutics.
TFCP2 acts as a transcription co-factor that stimulates YAP transcription by facilitating YAP binding with YAP binding motif (YBF)-containing transcription factors.

Studies reveal that TFCP2, TFCP2L1, UBP1 belong to a transcription factors subfamily and involved in various aspects of cancer types and development as either proto-oncogenes or tumor suppressors. They can directly interact with each other; TFCP2, TFCP2L1 and UBP1 can form heteromeric DNA-binding complexes. In addition, TFCP2L1 can modulate the activity of TFCP2 and UBP1. [review]
TFCP2 signaling is regulated by circular RNA hsa_circ_0023404 in the cervical cancer.

MAGE-A11 and transcription factors SP1,TFCP2 and ZEB1 expression were associated with some clinical features in patients, such as pathological differentiation, tumor size, clinical stage, lymph node metastasis and distant metastasis. Patients with ESCC having high MAGE-A11 and transcription factors (SP1,TFCP2 and ZEB1) expression had a worse prognosis compared to the patients with low expression.
A subset of epithelioid and spindle cell rhabdomyosarcomas is associated with TFCP2 fusions and common ALK upregulation.
CCT3 acts upstream of YAP and TFCP2 as a potential target and tumour biomarker in liver cancer.
The microtubule-associated histone methyltransferase SET8, facilitated by transcription factor LSF, methylates alpha-tubulin.
A Feedback Loop Comprising EGF/TGFalpha Sustains TFCP2-Mediated Breast Cancer Progression.
Transcription factors CP2 and YY1 as prognostic markers in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma: analysis of The Cancer Genome Atlas and a second independent cohort.
DNA hypermethylation contributes to colorectal cancer metastasis by regulating the binding of CEBPB and TFCP2 to the CPEB1 promoter.
circITCH suppresses cell proliferation and metastasis through miR-660/TFCP2 pathway in melanoma.
Transcription factor cellular promoter 2 is required for upstream binding protein 1 -mediated angiogenesis.
TFCP2 is a transcriptional regulator of heparan sulfate assembly and melanoma cell growth.
Human umbilical cord mesenchymal stem cell-derived extracellular vesicles loaded with TFCP2 activate Wnt/beta-catenin signaling to alleviate preeclampsia.
Multi-omic and functional analysis for classification and treatment of sarcomas with FUS-TFCP2 or EWSR1-TFCP2 fusions.
Analysis of the Expression of LSF Transcription Factor in the Regulation of Transcription and TSG101 during the Neoplastic Transformation of Endometrial Cells.

name: transcription factor CP2

pid.name: Signaling events mediated by HDAC Class I

summary: This gene encodes a transcription factor that binds the alpha-globin promoter and activates transcription of the alpha-globin gene. The encoded protein regulates erythroid gene expression, plays a role in the transcriptional switch of globin gene promoters, and it activates many other cellular and viral gene promoters. The gene product interacts with certain inflammatory response factors, and polymorphisms of this gene may be involved in the pathogenesis of Alzheimer's disease. [provided by RefSeq, Mar 2010].
